info.name: Abducens nucleus
info.description: The abducens nucleus contains the lower motor neurons of the abducens nerve that innervate the ipsilateral lateral rectus muscle. It also contains interneurons that project through the contralateral medial longitudinal fasciculus (MLF) to communicate with the contralateral medial rectus neurons in the oculomotor complex; these interneurons are instrumental for conjugate horizontal eye movements. The abducens nucleus is located close to the floor of the fourth ventricle beneath the elevation known as the facial colliculus. The facial motor nerve fibers that innervate the muscles of facial expression, travel over or superior to the abducens nucleus and beneath the facial colliculus.
info.item: /Sections/Thin, Whole Brain/Sagittal & Parasagittal/3 Sag Thin Sec
